key_points: Vanderbilt kicker Sarah Fuller to take part in President-elect Joe Biden's inauguration event.
The event, titled "Celebrating America", is a primetime special hosted by Tom Hanks.
Notable celebrities including Foo Fighters, John Legend, and Bruce Springsteen will appear.
The special aims to celebrate a new national journey toward a united America.
Eva Longoria and Kerry Washington will introduce segments highlighting young community leaders.
The inauguration special is scheduled to air Wednesday night following Biden's swearing-in.
Fuller shared her excitement and honor in being part of the inauguration on Twitter.
She highlighted the event's significance for American women and girls, urging to #LeadLikeAWoman.
Sarah Fuller made history as the first woman to score in a Power 5 football game in December.
"Celebrating America" will be broadcasted across major networks and streamed on various platforms.
